meanings.definition: The inner branch of a biramous limb in a crustacean.
meanings.sent1: The endopod of the crab's leg helps it move smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She carefully observed the endopod of the shrimp's appendage.
meanings.sent3: The endopod of the lobster's limb seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: The endopod of the crayfish's limb danced gracefully in the water.
meanings.sent5: The endopod of the barnacle's limb was like a delicate brush painting the ocean floor.

meanings.definition: The inner part of a limb in certain arthropods.
meanings.sent1: The endopod of the insect's leg was hidden beneath its exoskeleton.
meanings.sent2: He studied the endopod of the beetle's leg under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The endopod of the spider's limb played hide and seek with the scientist.
meanings.sent4: The endopod of the ant's leg was a secret weapon in its tiny arsenal.
meanings.sent5: The endopod of the grasshopper's leg propelled it forward with incredible speed.

meanings.definition: The inner segment of a biramous appendage in a crustacean.
meanings.sent1: The endopod of the lobster's limb was shorter than the exopod.
meanings.sent2: She marveled at the intricate design of the endopod in the crab's claw.
meanings.sent3: The endopod of the shrimp's appendage told jokes to the other crustaceans.
meanings.sent4: The endopod of the crayfish's limb was a hidden treasure waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The endopod of the barnacle's limb was a delicate masterpiece of nature's engineering.
